element_scores.name: Dataset Discovery and Identification
element_scores.description: Can a user or system discover and uniquely identify this dataset?

sub_elements.name: Persistent Identifier (DOI, RRID, or URI)
sub_elements.evidence: id: https://doi.org/10.18130/V3/DXWOS5
sub_elements.quality_note: DOI present and properly formatted as persistent identifier resolving to University of Virginia Dataverse
sub_elements.semantic_validation: DOI format validated - resolves to LibraData repository

sub_elements.name: Dataset Title and Description Completeness
sub_elements.evidence: title: Cell Maps for Artificial Intelligence (CM4AI); description: comprehensive 300+ word multi-paragraph description covering mission, data types, cell lines, methods, and packaging
sub_elements.quality_note: Clear, descriptive title with extremely comprehensive description covering project scope, methodology, data modalities, and AI-readiness framework
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Title and description exceptionally comprehensive and informative

sub_elements.name: Keywords or Tags for Searchability
sub_elements.evidence: keywords: 28 entries including Cell Maps, AI-Ready Data, Bridge2AI, domain terms, methods (AP-MS, SEC-MS, IF), cell lines, frameworks (FAIR, RO-Crate, FAIRSCAPE)
sub_elements.quality_note: Extensive keyword list covering domain, technical methods, cell lines, disease areas, and data standards
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Keywords cover multiple dimensions - scientific domain, technical methods, standards, biological systems

sub_elements.name: Landing Page and Resources (page, hierarchical resources)
sub_elements.evidence: page: https://www.cm4ai.org; external_resources with 12 resource entries; resources field not used
sub_elements.quality_note: Landing page URL provided; no hierarchical resources field but extensive external_resources list with project website, repositories, publications
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Landing page present; hierarchical resources structure not used but external resources comprehensive

sub_elements.name: Hierarchical Structure (parent datasets, relationships)
sub_elements.evidence: No parent_datasets or related_datasets fields found
sub_elements.quality_note: Missing hierarchical structure fields - dataset appears standalone without explicit parent/child relationships to other Bridge2AI datasets
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Schema fields parent_datasets and related_datasets not populated

element_scores.name: Dataset Access and Retrieval
element_scores.description: Can the dataset and its associated resources be located, accessed, and downloaded?

sub_elements.name: Access Policy and IP Restrictions Defined
sub_elements.evidence: license_and_use_terms: Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 with detailed description of requirements, commercial use restrictions, Data Access Committee oversight; ip_restrictions field not present
sub_elements.quality_note: Comprehensive access policy defined in license_and_use_terms including attribution requirements, non-commercial restriction, share-alike clause; IP restrictions not in separate field
sub_elements.semantic_validation: License terms comprehensive with explicit commercial use restrictions but ip_restrictions field missing

sub_elements.name: Regulatory Restrictions and Confidentiality Level Specified
sub_elements.evidence: license mentions Data Access Committee oversight for ethical matters and dual licensing; regulatory_restrictions and confidentiality_level fields not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Governance structure documented in license narrative but regulatory_restrictions and confidentiality_level schema fields not used
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Governance info present in narrative but not in structured fields

sub_elements.name: Download URL or Platform Link Available
sub_elements.evidence: distribution_formats.access_urls: https://doi.org/10.18130/V3/DXWOS5, https://doi.org/10.18130/V3/B35XWX, https://doi.org/10.18130/V3/F3TD5R, https://www.cm4ai.org; download_url field not used
sub_elements.quality_note: Multiple DOI-based access URLs provided in distribution_formats; download_url field not used
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Access URLs comprehensive with versioned DOIs

sub_elements.name: Distribution Formats and File Types Specified
sub_elements.evidence: distribution_formats: 5 entries (RO-Crate packages, MassIVE mass spec data, NCBI SRA sequence data, NDEx cell maps, UVA Dataverse archives)
sub_elements.quality_note: Multiple distribution platforms and formats clearly specified with repository-specific access methods
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Distribution formats comprehensive covering multiple data modalities and repositories

sub_elements.name: Related Datasets and External Resources Linked
sub_elements.evidence: external_resources: 12 entries including project website, NIH RePORTER, Dataverse DOIs, bioRxiv publication, FAIRSCAPE docs, IMP, NDEx, Bridge2AI program, CFDE, repositories; related_datasets field not present
sub_elements.quality_note: Extensive external resources but no typed relationships to related datasets or other Bridge2AI projects
sub_elements.semantic_validation: External resources comprehensive; related_datasets field not used

element_scores.name: Data Reuse and Interoperability
element_scores.description: Is sufficient information provided to reuse and integrate the dataset with others?

sub_elements.name: License Terms Allow Reuse
sub_elements.evidence: license_and_use_terms: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 explicitly permits research reuse with attribution, non-commercial restriction, share-alike requirement
sub_elements.quality_note: License explicitly supports research reuse with clear terms; commercial use requires separate negotiation
sub_elements.semantic_validation: License permits research reuse with appropriate safeguards and attribution requirements

sub_elements.name: Data Formats Are Standardized (encoding, format)
sub_elements.evidence: distribution_formats specify RO-Crate, JSON-LD, Parquet, TSV, MassIVE, NCBI SRA - all standard formats; format/encoding top-level fields not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Standard formats specified in distribution (RO-Crate, JSON-LD, repository-standard formats); metadata uses Schema.org and EVI vocabularies
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Formats standardized with emphasis on FAIR-compliant packaging but not in top-level format/encoding fields

sub_elements.name: Schema or Ontology Conformance Stated
sub_elements.evidence: cleaning_strategies documents mapping to Gene Ontology, Reactome, PDB, AlphaFold, Schema.org, EVI ontology, NCI Thesaurus, BioAssay Ontology, Cell Ontology, CHEBI; conforms_to field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Extensive ontology and standard conformance documented in cleaning_strategies; conforms_to field not used
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Schema/ontology conformance comprehensive but in narrative rather than conforms_to field

sub_elements.name: Variable Metadata with Identifiers Defined
sub_elements.evidence: cleaning_strategies mentions JSON-Schema mini-data-dictionaries for all datasets with validation; variables field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Variable metadata available via JSON-Schema dictionaries per dataset in RO-Crates; variables schema field not used
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Variable documentation exists in RO-Crate packages with JSON-Schema validation

sub_elements.name: Use Guidance Provided (intended, prohibited uses)
sub_elements.evidence: intended_uses: 6 entries covering AI model training, VNN development, genotype-phenotype mapping, drug response, disease mechanisms, exemplar use; discouraged_uses: 3 entries covering clinical use without validation, use during incomplete release, analysis without domain expertise; prohibited_uses field not present
sub_elements.quality_note: Comprehensive use guidance with intended and discouraged uses; prohibited_uses field not used but restrictions clear in license (commercial requires separate license)
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Use guidance comprehensive covering both recommendations and strong warnings about limitations

element_scores.name: Ethical Use and Privacy Safeguards
element_scores.description: Does the dataset provide clear information about consent, privacy, and ethical oversight?

sub_elements.name: IRB or Ethics Review Documented
sub_elements.evidence: human_subject_research: explicitly states non-human subjects research, de-identified cell lines from commercial sources; ethics_review_board lists CM4AI Ethics Module (Ravitsky, BÃ©lisle-Pipon), Data Access Committee (Parker), Bridge2AI Ethics Working Group; ethical_reviews field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Ethics oversight documented with ethics module leaders and committee structure; N/A for IRB (non-human subjects) but ethical review process documented
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Ethics review comprehensive despite non-human subjects designation; ethical_reviews list field not used

sub_elements.name: Deidentification Method Described
sub_elements.evidence: human_subject_research: 'considered to be de-identified as they cannot be matched, with current knowledge, to a human subject'; sensitive_elements: 'While cell lines are de-identified and cannot be matched to specific individuals...'; is_deidentified field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: De-identification status clearly stated with explanation that commercial cell lines cannot be matched to individuals; is_deidentified class field not used
sub_elements.semantic_validation: De-identification clearly documented in narrative fields with scientific justification

sub_elements.name: Privacy Protections Beyond Deidentification
sub_elements.evidence: Data Access Committee for ethical supervision, dual licensing for commercial use monitoring, ethics team plan for IP protection and commercialization monitoring; participant_privacy field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Privacy governance documented through Data Access Committee oversight and ethical licensing framework; participant_privacy field N/A for cell line data
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Governance protections documented; participant_privacy field appropriately not used for non-human subjects

sub_elements.name: Informed Consent Obtained from Participants
sub_elements.evidence: human_subject_research: cell lines are 'ethically sourced' from ATCC and HipSci with proper material transfer agreements; informed_consent field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Ethical sourcing documented through commercial repositories with established consent frameworks; original consent N/A (historical de-identified cell lines)
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Ethical sourcing documented; informed_consent field appropriately not used for commercial cell lines

sub_elements.name: Vulnerable Populations and Compensation Documented
sub_elements.evidence: human_subject_research.special_populations: lists MDA-MB-468 derived from 51-year-old black female (de-identified), KOLF2.1J from healthy male Northern European donor (de-identified); vulnerable_populations and participant_compensation fields not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Original donor demographics documented for scientific context; vulnerable_populations and compensation N/A for historical de-identified cell lines
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Donor metadata documented; vulnerable populations and compensation fields appropriately not used

element_scores.name: Data Composition and Structure
element_scores.description: Can the dataset's structure, modality, and population be understood from metadata?

sub_elements.name: Cohort or Subpopulations Characteristics Described
sub_elements.evidence: subpopulations: 7 entries describing MDA-MB-468 under three conditions (untreated, paclitaxel, vorinostat) and KOLF2.1J in four states (undifferentiated iPSCs, neurons, NPCs, cardiomyocytes)
sub_elements.quality_note: Comprehensive subpopulation characterization with treatment conditions and differentiation states clearly defined
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Subpopulations well-defined with experimental conditions and cell states

sub_elements.name: Number of Instances or Samples Reported
sub_elements.evidence: instances: 4 detailed entries - 2 cell lines (MDA-MB-468, KOLF2.1J) and 2 protein target sets (100 chromatin regulators, 100 metabolic enzymes) with specific progress metrics (17 genes tagged, 72/100 chromatin modifiers in SEC-MS, etc.)
sub_elements.quality_note: Clear instance definitions with quantitative progress tracking for protein targets across modalities
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Instance counts specific with detailed progress metrics

sub_elements.name: Variable-Level Metadata and Tabular Flag
sub_elements.evidence: cleaning_strategies: 'characterizing and validating all datasets with JSON-Schema mini-data-dictionaries'; hierarchical cell maps with 10 layers; variables and is_tabular fields not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Variable metadata via JSON-Schema dictionaries for all datasets in RO-Crates; complex hierarchical DAG structure beyond simple tabular
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Variable metadata available in RO-Crate packages; non-tabular hierarchical graph data structure

sub_elements.name: Data Topics or Conditions Represented
sub_elements.evidence: instances and subpopulations describe cancer (triple-negative breast cancer, paclitaxel/vorinostat treatment), neuropsychiatric disorders (neuron differentiation), cardiac disorders (cardiomyocyte differentiation); proteins involved in cancer, neuropsychiatric, and cardiac disorders
sub_elements.quality_note: Comprehensive description of disease topics and cellular conditions across multiple therapeutic areas
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Data topics clearly enumerated across cell lines, treatments, and differentiation states

sub_elements.name: Data Quality Issues and Anomalies Documented
sub_elements.evidence: sampling_strategies with is_sample: false, is_random: false, is_representative: false flags; preprocessing and cleaning strategies document QC procedures; anomalies field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Sampling characteristics documented; extensive QC procedures in preprocessing/cleaning but no explicit anomalies documentation
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Sampling documented; QC procedures comprehensive; anomalies field not used

sub_elements.quality_note: Version numbers documented in updates narrative but not in version schema field
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Versions documented in updates with persistent identifiers but version field not used

sub_elements.name: Version Access Methods Documented

sub_elements.quality_note: Version access via versioned DOIs in Dataverse; version_access class field not used

sub_elements.name: Change Descriptions and Errata Provided

sub_elements.quality_note: Comprehensive version change documentation in updates; errata field not used

sub_elements.name: Update Schedule or Frequency Indicated
sub_elements.evidence: updates.frequency: 'Quarterly updates through November 2026; long-term preservation thereafter'
sub_elements.quality_note: Update frequency and timeline clearly stated with project end date and preservation plan
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Update schedule documented with clear timeline and preservation commitment

sub_elements.name: Provenance and Source Derivation Documented
sub_elements.evidence: D4D header: 'Source: data/preprocessed/concatenated/CM4AI_preprocessed.txt (122K, 6 source files)'; cleaning_strategies: 'FAIRSCAPE framework creates RO-Crate packages with datasets, metadata, provenance graphs, and software... computes end-to-end provenance entailments using EVI Evidence Graph Ontology'; was_derived_from and release_notes fields not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Generation provenance in header; extensive provenance infrastructure via FAIRSCAPE with machine-readable provenance graphs; schema provenance fields not used
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Provenance comprehensive via FAIRSCAPE framework but not in schema provenance fields

element_scores.name: Scientific Motivation and Funding Transparency
element_scores.description: Does the metadata clearly state why the dataset exists and who funded it?

sub_elements.name: Motivation or Purpose for Dataset Creation
sub_elements.evidence: purposes: 3 detailed entries - AI-Ready cell architecture maps for biomedical AI, interpretable genotype-phenotype learning, establishing AI-readiness standards for biomedical data
sub_elements.quality_note: Comprehensive purpose statements covering scientific goals (visible ML, genotype-phenotype), technical goals (AI-ready standards), and methodological goals (multi-scale cell mapping)
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Purpose clearly articulated across scientific, technical, and standards dimensions

sub_elements.name: Primary Research Objectives or Tasks
sub_elements.evidence: tasks: 4 entries - multi-scale cell mapping via MuSIC pipeline, visible neural network development, disease-relevant cell line characterization, ethical AI framework development; addressing_gaps: 3 entries on black box AI, lack of AI-ready datasets, multimodal integration
sub_elements.quality_note: Detailed task descriptions for technical pipeline, AI methods, experimental systems, and ethics; complemented by gap analysis
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Tasks comprehensive covering computational methods, experimental work, and ethical frameworks

sub_elements.name: Funding Sources and Mechanisms Listed
sub_elements.evidence: funders: NIH Common Fund Bridge2AI Program with detailed description including two grant numbers, opportunity number, administering office, additional Frederick Thomas Fund
sub_elements.quality_note: Funding sources clearly identified with NIH grants, opportunity number, administering offices, and supplemental funding
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Funding sources comprehensive with federal and institutional support documented

sub_elements.name: Grant IDs or Award Numbers Present
sub_elements.evidence: funders: grants 1OT2OD032742-01 (Bridge2AI Functional Genomics) and 5U54HG012513-02 (Bridge2AI Bridge Center), opportunity OTA-21-008, project dates, FY2025 funding amounts (total $5,289,382)
sub_elements.quality_note: Specific grant numbers, opportunity number, project timeline, and detailed budget information provided
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Grant identifiers complete with financial transparency and timeline

sub_elements.name: Creators and Acknowledgements Documented
sub_elements.evidence: creators: 15 entries including Contact PI/Project Leader (Trey Ideker), 14 Co-Investigators with affiliations and module roles (Ethics, Standards, Teaming, Data Acquisition, etc.)
sub_elements.quality_note: Comprehensive creator list with roles, affiliations, and module leadership responsibilities
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Creator attribution complete with detailed role assignments across project modules

element_scores.name: Technical Transparency (Data Collection and Processing)
element_scores.description: Can data collection and processing steps be replicated or understood?

sub_elements.name: Collection Mechanisms and Settings Described
sub_elements.evidence: collection_mechanisms: 4 detailed entries - immunofluorescence spatial proteomics (automated protocols, antibodies from HPA), affinity purification mass spec (endogenous tagging), size exclusion chromatography mass spec (proteome-wide complex mapping), CRISPR perturbation screens (single-cell with 10x Genomics)
sub_elements.quality_note: Collection mechanisms comprehensively documented with technical details, protocols, instrumentation, and laboratory sources
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Collection process highly detailed and replicable from documentation

sub_elements.name: Data Acquisition Methods Listed
sub_elements.evidence: acquisition_methods: 4 entries - confocal microscopy for subcellular imaging (4-channel IF with HPA deep learning), mass spectrometry for protein interactions (AP-MS and SEC-MS with node2vec), single-cell RNA sequencing (10x Genomics 3'HT), MuSIC pipeline integration (contrastive deep learning, community detection)
sub_elements.quality_note: All acquisition modalities documented with instrumentation, computational methods, and integration pipeline details
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Acquisition methods thorough covering imaging, proteomics, transcriptomics, and computational integration

sub_elements.name: Preprocessing, Cleaning, and Labeling Strategies
sub_elements.evidence: preprocessing_strategies: 5 entries (deep learning embeddings, hierarchical community detection, cell map annotation, QC for imaging, QC for mass spec); cleaning_strategies: 3 entries (FAIRSCAPE AI-readiness packaging, data standard mapping, integrative structure modeling annotation); labeling_strategies field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Extensive preprocessing (embeddings, community detection, annotation, QC) and cleaning (FAIRSCAPE, ontology mapping, structure annotation) documented; labeling not applicable for unsupervised cell map generation
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Preprocessing and cleaning comprehensive with AI methods and FAIR packaging; labeling not applicable

sub_elements.name: Software and Tools Documented
sub_elements.evidence: Preprocessing/acquisition mentions node2vec, Human Protein Atlas deep learning model, Cytoscape, LLM annotation, Gene Ontology, Reactome, FAIRSCAPE-CLI; cleaning mentions PDB, AlphaFoldDB, crosslinking MS; software_and_tools field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Major software tools and resources documented in preprocessing/acquisition narratives but not in software_and_tools schema field
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Software comprehensively documented in narratives; schema field not used

sub_elements.name: External Standards and Resources Referenced
sub_elements.evidence: external_resources: 12 entries; cleaning_strategies documents standards: Gene Ontology, Reactome, PDB, AlphaFold, Schema.org, EVI, NCI Thesaurus, BioAssay Ontology, Cell Ontology, CHEBI; conforms_to field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: External standards and resources extensively referenced in cleaning and external_resources; conforms_to field not used
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Standards and resources comprehensively documented; conforms_to field missing

issues_detected.description: Many optional schema fields not populated despite relevant information existing in other fields
issues_detected.recommendation: Consider populating optional schema fields to improve machine-readability and semantic interoperability, especially for standards conformance (conforms_to), software tools, and version management

issues_detected.description: Important information often in narrative fields rather than structured schema fields
issues_detected.recommendation: Extract structured information from narratives into dedicated schema fields when available (e.g., software tools from preprocessing, ontologies from cleaning into conforms_to)

issues_detected.description: Systematic biases not explicitly documented despite purposive cell line selection
issues_detected.recommendation: Add known_biases documenting cell line selection bias (two specific cancer/iPSC lines), treatment selection bias (paclitaxel/vorinostat), protein target selection bias (chromatin/metabolic), and potential limitations for generalization to other cell types or conditions

issues_detected.description: Missing typed relationships to other Bridge2AI datasets and broader ecosystem
issues_detected.recommendation: Add related_datasets linking to other Bridge2AI projects (AI-READI, VOICE, CHORUS) and parent Bridge2AI program dataset with typed relationships (e.g., 'part_of', 'related_to')

semantic_analysis.semantic_insights: CM4AI D4D datasheet demonstrates exceptional documentation comprehensiveness with extraordinary detail across all major categories. The dataset achieves 48/50 points primarily through extremely rich narrative documentation covering motivation, composition, collection, preprocessing, ethics, distribution, and maintenance. The dataset is distinguished by its sophisticated AI-readiness infrastructure (FAIRSCAPE framework, RO-Crate packaging, provenance graphs, JSON-Schema validation), multimodal data integration (spatial proteomics, protein interactions, transcriptomics), and comprehensive standards conformance (Gene Ontology, Reactome, PDB, AlphaFold, Schema.org, EVI). Key strengths include: detailed technical transparency (4 collection mechanisms, 4 acquisition methods, 5 preprocessing strategies, 3 cleaning strategies with extensive computational pipeline documentation), comprehensive ethics framework (Value-Sensitive Design, axiological repositories, Data Access Committee), extensive provenance tracking via FAIRSCAPE with machine-readable graphs, clear versioning with DOI-based access to multiple beta releases, transparent funding and creator attribution with detailed budget information, and sophisticated use guidance distinguishing intended uses from discouraged uses. Primary opportunities for improvement: explicit bias documentation (cell line selection, protein target selection, treatment choice biases affecting generalizability), structured schema field utilization (version, publisher, citation, conforms_to, software_and_tools, variables), typed dataset relationships to other Bridge2AI projects, and explicit anomalies documentation if quality issues identified during QC. The interim/beta release status is transparently communicated with clear limitations about incomplete data overlap and ongoing embargoes. Overall, this is an exemplary datasheet demonstrating best practices in AI-ready biomedical dataset documentation with particular strength in technical methods, provenance, and FAIR principles implementation.

recommendations: Add known_biases field documenting: (1) Cell line selection bias - MDA-MB-468 and KOLF2.1J are specific models that may not generalize to all cancer types or cell contexts, (2) Treatment selection bias - paclitaxel and vorinostat chosen but other perturbations may yield different results, (3) Protein target selection bias - chromatin modifiers and metabolic enzymes focus may not capture other important cellular systems, (4) Cell line origin bias - specific donor characteristics (race, sex, disease state) affecting biological generalizability
Populate version field with current version (V2.1 based on updates narrative)
Add publisher field: 'University of Virginia / University of California San Diego / Stanford University / University of California San Francisco'

Create formatted citation field: 'Clark T, et al. Cell Maps for Artificial Intelligence: AI-Ready Maps of Human Cell Architecture from Disease-Relevant Cell Lines. University of Virginia Dataverse, 2025. https://doi.org/10.18130/V3/DXWOS5'
Add conforms_to field listing: FAIR Principles, RO-Crate Specification, Schema.org, EVI Evidence Graph Ontology, Gene Ontology, Reactome, Protein Data Bank, AlphaFold Protein Structure Database

Populate software_and_tools field extracting from preprocessing/acquisition: node2vec (PPI embeddings), Human Protein Atlas deep learning model (image embeddings), Cytoscape (community detection), FAIRSCAPE-CLI (RO-Crate packaging), MuSIC pipeline (multimodal integration), Gene Ontology tools, Reactome tools, large language models (annotation)
Add variables field with structured variable metadata from JSON-Schema dictionaries in RO-Crate packages (if extractable)
Add is_tabular: false given hierarchical DAG structure of cell maps (non-tabular graph data)
Add format, media_type, encoding for top-level dataset characteristics (e.g., application/zip for RO-Crate, application/ld+json for metadata)
Consider adding anomalies field if specific quality issues identified during QC procedures documented in preprocessing

Add related_datasets entries linking to: (1) Bridge2AI parent program dataset (relationship: 'part_of'), (2) Other Bridge2AI datasets - AI-READI, VOICE, CHORUS (relationship: 'related_to'), (3) Human Protein Atlas (relationship: 'uses_resource_from'), (4) CORUM protein complex database if used (relationship: 'validated_against')
Add parent_datasets entry for Bridge2AI program if overall program dataset exists

Add prohibited_uses field distinguishing from discouraged_uses (e.g., 'Commercial use without separate license agreement', 'Redistribution without share-alike license', 'Use for re-identification purposes')
Create version_access class documenting DOI-based version access mechanism with links to all versioned releases
Add regulatory_restrictions documenting Data Access Committee oversight requirements if applicable
Add confidentiality_level if applicable to RO-Crate access tiers or pre-publication embargoed data
Populate is_deidentified class with detailed explanation of de-identification status for cell lines
Add ethical_reviews list entry with CM4AI Ethics Module details, Data Access Committee composition, review dates, and ethical framework (Value-Sensitive Design)
Add download_url pointing to primary Dataverse download or cm4ai.org data portal
